Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2008 09:15AM montana29 wrote: Dear Ones,   After three hours of tests yesterday I was able to corner the overseeing hospital doctor.  The techs were very nice and completely incompetent--just the way I like it.  When the doctor reran the sonogram she found all the spots the two former doctors had found plus the one I found plus to my surprise my silent left breast stood up with something to say.  The doctor is going,  "That could be" or "Maybe not" but "Hurray, the good news I see no CANCER.  See you in six months."   I just smiled and thought NO WAY.  At 66 five times of why are you wasting my time is all this old gal can take, This isn't my first bout with the C word and  I'm out of here.  At the end of the hall standing with open arms was my childhood sweetheart.  He was relieved.  I was so pleased with the way he had handled all my unravelings. Thanks to you Jeannae and best wishes and especially to Shirlann for her encouraging words. You saw me through.
Posts.Title: 20 and scared out of my mind!!! jenamae mbarnes

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2008 05:25PM montana29 wrote: I'm scared spiteless.   And I am sixty-six and a half as my grand children would say and tomorrow is the mammogram and the sonogram.  That's not what scares me.  Been there.  Done that.  It's the white coat synodrome.  I have been through this four times over the last twenty years and it is always the same.  Only this time its bigger, and sore to the touch and as the beloved doctor is quickly backing out his open door, I'm saying what's going on?  He says sternly, " You have two cysts and the third one I don't have any idea, but I'd get it checked.out."  The first time twenty years ago after aspiration the doctor says to me, "You women you read an article in READERS DIGEST and you get all bent out of shape."  He was literally laughing at me How come no one over sixty is writing - I wonder
Posts.Title: 20 and scared out of my mind!!! jenamae mbarnes
